customer_addr:
3101 SE Ferry Slip Rd
Newport, OR 97365

citations.narrative:
On 13FEB2025 four Orange Cheek waxbills and one ground dove were out of their primary enclosures and were perched
above their enclosure or on the ground in proximity to the bank of cages. The facility representative said the birds
escaped when an employee entered the enclosures. Escaped birds are at risk of injury and could potentially get out of the
facility altogether. All enclosures must safely contain the birds, and precautions should be taken when opening the door to
the birds' primary enclosures to prevent escapes.
Correct from 13 February 2025 onward.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
There is an excessive amount of excreta in the finch group, diamond dove group and pigeon group enclosures. The floors
of the enclosures are primarily covered with pine shavings and removed and replaced on a routine basis. There is
significant build up of bird waste material on the floors, perches and enrichment items. Excessive excreta and food waste
in primary enclosures can soil the birds, increase disease hazards, and attract pests into the enclosure. Remove excreta
and food waste from primary enclosures and from under and around primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent
excessive accumulation. Correct by 28 February 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.153(a)(1)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
On 13FEB2025 four Orange Cheek waxbills and one ground dove were out of their primary enclosures and were perched 
above their enclosure or on the ground in proximity to the bank of cages. The facility representative said the birds 
escaped when an employee entered the enclosures. Escaped birds are at risk of injury and could potentially get out of the 
facility altogether. All enclosures must safely contain the birds, and precautions should be taken when opening the door to 
the birds' primary enclosures to prevent escapes. 
Correct from 13 February 2025 onward. 
3.158(a)(1) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
There is an excessive amount of excreta in the finch group, diamond dove group and pigeon group enclosures. The floors 
of the enclosures are primarily covered with pine shavings and removed and replaced on a routine basis. There is 
significant build up of bird waste material on the floors, perches and enrichment items. Excessive excreta and food waste 
in primary enclosures can soil the birds, increase disease hazards, and attract pests into the enclosure. Remove excreta 
and food waste from primary enclosures and from under and around primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent 
excessive accumulation. Correct by 28 February 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
 n
